H0.text: It was lost as potential energy when Rosa and Ted used all the chemical energy from the granola bars during the swimming competition, with less than 50% converted to mechanical energy.

H1.text: It was lost as chemical energy during Rosa and Ted’s swimming competition, where less than 50 % of the chemical energy in the granola bars they ate before competing was converted to mechanical energy.

H2.text: It was converted to thermal energy when Rosa and Ted ate granola bars before a swimming competition, and less than 50% of the chemical energy in those bars was turned into mechanical energy during the swim, so the remaining energy was dissipated as heat.

H3.text: The rest of the chemical energy from the granola bars, after less than 50% was converted to mechanical energy during Rosa and Ted's swimming competition, was converted to magnetic energy.

A6.text: In a conventional automobile, chemical energy in the fuel is converted into kinetic energy of expanding gas via combustion, but some energy is lost as heat due to friction and similar processes.
